module.description: Register fields should be considered static unless otherwise noted as dynamic.

register.description: The clock control register handels clock settings in the CC2538. The settings in CLOCK_CTRL do not always reflect the current chip status which is found in CLOCK_STA register.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
Disable calibration 32-kHz RC oscillator. 0: Enable calibration 1: Disable calibration
32-kHz clock oscillator selection 0: 32-kHz crystal oscillator 1: 32-kHz RC oscillator
Reserved. Always read 0.
Amplitude detector of XOSC during power up 0: No action 1: Delay qualification of XOSC until amplitude is greater than the threshold.
Reserved. Always read 0.
0: Power up both oscillators 1: Power down oscillator not selected by OSC bit (hardware-controlled when selected).
System clock oscillator selection 0: 32-MHz crystal oscillator 1: 16-MHz HF-RC oscillator
Reserved. Always read 0.
I/O clock rate setting Cannot be higher than OSC setting 000: 32 MHz 001: 16 MHz 010: 8 MHz 011: 4 MHz 100: 2 MHz 101: 1 MHz 110: 0.5 MHz 111: 0.25 MHz
Reserved. Always read 0.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
System clock rate setting Cannot be higher than OSC setting 000: 32 MHz 001: 16 MHz 010: 8 MHz 011: 4 MHz 100: 2 MHz 101: 1 MHz 110: 0.5 MHz 111: 0.25 MHz

register.description: Clock status register This register reflects the current chip status.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
32-kHz clock source synced to undivided system clock (16 or 32 MHz).
Disable calibration 32-kHz RC oscillator. 0: Calibration enabled 1: Calibration disabled
Current 32-kHz clock oscillator selected. 0: 32-kHz crystal oscillator 1: 32-kHz RC oscillator
Returns last source of reset 00: POR 01: External reset 10: WDT 11: CLD or software reset
Reserved. Always read 0.
0: System clock is not requested to change. 1: A change of system clock source has been initiated and is not finished. Same as when OSC bit in CLOCK_STA and CLOCK_CTRL register are not equal
XOSC stable status 0: XOSC is not powered up or not yet stable. 1: XOSC is powered up and stable.
HSOSC stable status 0: HSOSC is not powered up or not yet stable. 1: HSOSC is powered up and stable.
0: Both oscillators powered up and stable and OSC_PD_CMD = 0. 1: Oscillator not selected by CLOCK_CTRL.OSC bit is powered down.
Current clock source selected 0: 32-MHz crystal oscillator 1: 16-MHz HF-RC oscillator
Reserved. Always read 0.
Returns current functional frequency for IO_CLK (may differ from setting in the CLOCK_CTRL register) 000: 32 MHz 001: 16 MHz 010: 8 MHz 011: 4 MHz 100: 2 MHz 101: 1 MHz 110: 0.5 MHz 111: 0.25 MHz
Reserved. Always read 0.
Returns current functional frequency for real-time clock. (may differ from setting in the CLOCK_CTRL register) 1x : 8 MHz 01: 2 MHz 00: 62.5 kHz

Returns current functional frequency for system clock (may differ from setting in the CLOCK_CTRL register) 000: 32 MHz 001: 16 MHz 010: 8 MHz 011: 4 MHz 100: 2 MHz 101: 1 MHz 110: 0.5 MHz 111: 0.25 MHz

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for GPT[3:0] when the CPU is in active (run) mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for GPT3 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT3 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT2 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT2 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT1 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT1 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT0 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for GPT[3:0] when the CPU is in sleep mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for GPT3 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT3 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT2 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT2 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT1 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT1 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT0 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for GPT[3:0] when the CPU is in PM0. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for GPT3 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT3 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT2 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT2 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT1 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT1 is enabled.
0: Clock for GPT0 is gated. 1: Clock for GPT0 is enabled.

register.description: This register controls the reset for GPT[3:0].

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: GPT3 module is not reset 1: GPT3 module is reset
0: GPT2 module is not reset 1: GPT2 module is reset
0: GPT1 module is not reset 1: GPT1 module is reset
0: GPT0 module is not reset 1: GPT0 module is reset

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for SSI[1:0] when the CPU is in active (run) mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for SSI1 is gated. 1: Clock for SSI1 is enabled.
0: Clock for SSI0 is gated. 1: Clock for SSI0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for SSI[1:0] when the CPU is insSleep mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for SSI1 is gated. 1: Clock for SSI1 is enabled.
0: Clock for SSI0 is gated. 1: Clock for SSI0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for SSI[1:0] when the CPU is in PM0. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for SSI1 is gated. 1: Clock for SSI1 is enabled.
0: Clock for SSI0 is gated. 1: Clock for SSI0 is enabled.

register.description: This register controls the reset for SSI[1:0].

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: SSI1 module is not reset 1: SSI1 module is reset
0: SSI0 module is not reset 1: SSI0 module is reset

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for UART[1:0] when the CPU is in active (run) mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for UART1 is gated. 1: Clock for UART1 is enabled.
0: Clock for UART0 is gated. 1: Clock for UART0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for UART[1:0] when the CPU is in sleep mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for UART1 is gated. 1: Clock for UART1 is enabled.
0: Clock for UART0 is gated. 1: Clock for UART0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for UART[1:0] when the CPU is in PM0. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for UART1 is gated. 1: Clock for UART1 is enabled.
0: Clock for UART0 is gated. 1: Clock for UART0 is enabled.

register.description: This register controls the reset for UART[1:0].

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: UART1 module is not reset 1: UART1 module is reset
0: UART0 module is not reset 1: UART0 module is reset

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for I2C when the CPU is in active (run) mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for I2C0 is gated. 1: Clock for I2C0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for I2C when the CPU is in sleep mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for I2C0 is gated. 1: Clock for I2C0 is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for I2C when the CPU is in PM0. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for I2C0 is gated. 1: Clock for I2C0 is enabled.

register.description: This register controls the reset for I2C.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: I2C0 module is not reset 1: I2C0 module is reset

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for the security module when the CPU is in active (run) mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for AES is gated. 1: Clock for AES is enabled.
0: Clock for PKA is gated. 1: Clock for PKA is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for the security module when the CPU is in sleep mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for AES is gated. 1: Clock for AES is enabled.
0: Clock for PKA is gated. 1: Clock for PKA is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for the security module when the CPU is in PM0. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for AES is gated. 1: Clock for AES is enabled.
0: Clock for PKA is gated. 1: Clock for PKA is enabled.

register.description: This register controls the reset for the security module.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: AES module is not reset 1: AES module is reset
0: PKA module is not reset 1: PKA module is reset

register.description: This register controls the power mode. Note: The Corresponding PM is not entered before the WFI instruction is asserted. To enter PM1-3 the DEEPSLEEP bit in SYSCTRL must be 1.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
00: No action 01: PM1 10: PM2 11: PM3

register.description: This register controls CRC on state retention.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
1: Enable reset of chip if CRC fails. 0: Disable reset feature of chip due to CRC.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
1: Enable reset of chip if CRC fails. 0: Disable reset feature of chip due to CRC.

register.description: Power debug register

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: No action 1: When written high, the chip is reset in the same manner as a CLD event and is readable from the RST field in the CLOCK_STA register.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved bit. To provide compatibility with future products, the value of a reserved bit should be preserved across a read-modify-write operation.

register.description: This register controls the clock loss detection feature.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: CLD status in always-on domain is not equal to status in the EN register. 1: CLD status in always-on domain and EN register are equal.
Reserved. Always read zero
0: CLD is disabled. 1: CLD is enabled. Writing to this register shall be ignored if VALID = 0

register.description: This register controls interrupt wake-up.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
1: Enable SM Timer wake-up interrupt. 0: Disable SM Timer wake-up interrupt.
1: Enable USB wake-up interrupt. 0: Disable USB wake-up interrupt.
1: Enable port D wake-up interrupt. 0: Disable port D wake-up interrupt.
1: Enable port C wake-up interrupt. 0: Disable port C wake-up interrupt.
1: Enable port B wake-up interrupt. 0: Disable port B wake-up interrupt.
1: Enable port A wake-up interrupt. 0: Disable port A wake-up interrupt.

register.description: This register selects which interrupt map to be used.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
1: Select alternate interrupt map. 0: Select regular interrupt map. (See the ASD document for details.)

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for RF CORE when the CPU is in active (run) mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for RF CORE is gated. 1: Clock for RF CORE is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for RF CORE when the CPU is in sleep mode. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for RF CORE is gated. 1: Clock for RF CORE is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the module clocks for RF CORE when the CPU is in PM0. This register setting is don't care for PM1-3, because the system clock is powered down in these modes.

bitfield.description: This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.
0: Clock for RF CORE is gated. 1: Clock for RF CORE is enabled.

register.description: This register defines the emulator override controls for power mode and peripheral clock gate.

bitfield.description: Unused. This register is 8 bits in a 32-bit address space.

ICEPick 'Force Active' clock gate override bit. 'Force Active' is an ICEPick command.
1 --> In non-sleep power mode, peripherals clocks are forced to follow RCG* register settings. It forces CM3 clocks on.
0 --> Does not affect the peripheral clock settings.

ICEPick 'Force Power' clock gate override bit. 'Force Power' is an ICEPick command.
1 --> In non-sleep power mode, peripherals clocks are forced to follow RCG* register settings. It forces CM3 clocks on.
0 --> Does not affect the peripheral clock settings.

ICEPick 'Inhibit Sleep' clock gate override bit. 'Inhibit Sleep' is an ICEPick command.
1 --> In non-sleep power mode, peripherals clocks are forced to follow RCG* register settings. It forces CM3 clocks on.
0 --> Does not affect the peripheral clock settings.

ICEMelter 'WAKEUPEMU' clock gate override bit.
1 --> In non-sleep power mode, peripherals clocks are forced to follow RCG* register settings. It forces CM3 clocks on.
0 --> Does not affect the peripheral clock settings

ICEPick 'Force Active' power mode override bit. 'Force Active' is an ICEPick command.
1 --> Prohibit the system to go into any power down modes. Keeps the emulator attached. 0 --> Does not override any power mode settings from SYSREGS and does not prohibit system to go into any power down modes.

ICEPick 'Force Power' power mode override bit. 'Force Power' is an ICEPick command.
1 --> Prohibit the system to go into any power down modes. Keeps the emulator attached. 0 --> Does not override any power mode settings from SYSREGS and does not prohibit system to go into any power down modes.

ICEPick 'Inhibit Sleep' power mode override bit. 'Inhibit Sleep' is an ICEPick command.
1 --> Prohibit the system to go into any power down modes. Keeps the emulator attached. 0 --> Does not override any power mode settings from SYSREGS and does not prohibit system to go into any power down modes.

ICEMelter 'WAKEUPEMU' power mode override bit.
1 --> Prohibit the system to go into any power down modes. Keeps the emulator attached. 0 --> Does not override any power mode settings from SYSREGS and does not prohibit system to go into any power down modes.
